name: St. Henry Morse

locations.description: Jesuit priest martyred in London, England

summary: Henry Morse was an English Jesuit priest and martyr who was executed during the reign of Charles I. He converted to Catholicism while studying law, entered the Jesuits, and returned to England to minister secretly. He was particularly known for his work during the plague in London, where he risked his life to minister to the sick. He was arrested, tried, and executed at Tyburn. He is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales.
